meta.title: Rice Crop Expert System (based on Kharisma et al. 2020)
meta.source_reference: Kharisma, Y. et al. (2020) Rice crop management expert system with forwarding chaining method and certainty factor. J. Phys.: Conf. Ser. 1524 012037

A1.question: Leaves or edges of the leaves are brownish-gray?

A2.question: The leaves have brown spots shaped like a rhombus?

A3.question: The leaves have narrow, elongated brown spots?

A4.question: White patches or lines on the leaves (tubes/leaf rolls)?

A5.question: Leaves yellow to orange-yellow, visible green leafhoppers?

A6.question: Stem dries and brown planthopper seen at base?

A7.question: Shoots of rice stem dry and easily removed?

A8.question: Inside the plant stem, there are larvae/caterpillars?

A9.question: Stem yellow or brownish-red with black bed?

A12.question: Remaining rice seeds fall, birds in the field?

B2.question: Shoots or leaf edges brownish-gray and spread?

B3.question: Shoots and leaf edges dry out and wither?

B4.question: Rice panicles rotten/broken in generative phase?

B9.question: Rice pan stands upright but empty?

B10.question: Color/taste of rice grains changes unpleasantly?

B15.question: Young plants die and dry out?

rules.note: Sequential rule — complication from bacterial leaf blight
Sequential rule — complication from brown planthopper
Parallel rule — partial symptom match for bacterial leaf blight

labels.P03: Narrow brown leaf spot (Cercospora oryzae Miyake)
labels.P04: Green leafhopper and tungro (Rice tungro bacilliform virus)
labels.K01: Yield loss due to bacterial leaf blight (complication)
labels.K02: Crop damage due to planthopper infestation
